title: Corporate Inverters Earnings Stripping Reform Act of 2014
content: Corporate Inverters Earnings Stripping Reform Act of 2014 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose limitations on the tax deduction for interest paid by corporations which are designated as applicable entities . Prohibits such an entity from claiming a tax deduction for interest that exceeds 25 of its adjusted taxable income and from carrying forward interest which is paid or accrued during the first year in which such entity becomes an applicable entity. Requires an applicable entity to file an annual application for an approval agreement with the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) during the 10-year period after it becomes an applicable entity.
